questions.question_text:
You are administering an ORACLE RAC database with multiple instances.
Examine this command executed from the PROD1 instance which succeeds:
CREATE SPFILE FROM MEMORY;
Which statement is true?

choices.B: An SPFILE is created and contains parameter settings for all instances.
choices.A: An SPFILE is created and contains parameter settings only for PROD1.
choices.C: An SPFILE is created for each instance containing instance-specific parameter settings only.
choices.D: An SPFILE is created for each instance and contains parameter settings for all instances.
Database clients must disconnect before the online relocation timeout expires.
choices.E: Database clients must use Transaction Guard to prevent them from losing their connection.
choices.B: The database must have at least two UNDO tablespaces.
choices.A: The database must be stored on shared storage.
choices.C: The database must have at least two redo threads defined by the DBA.

questions.question_text:
Examine this command and output:
//IMG//

You want to relocate this database online to node 016n2.
Which two statements must be true for a successful online migration? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
In my opinion, the answer is: A and F
Usage Notes
If the Oracle RAC One Node database you want to relocate is not running, then the command returns an error.

https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/RACAD/GUID-AA0CB87B-7A76-4049-8560-4F39B2B9BF26.htm#RACAD8038

Using DBCA the correct is A
Oracle Database 12c: RAC Administration 3 - 24

comments.content:
but, if it is minimal steps you can skip the Verify, because when the clusterware is installed, validate the completed cluster installation and configuration by using the Cluster Verification Utility
Correct is D

discussion.content: Think D is the correct answer

questions.question_text:
You plan to use DBCA to convert a single-instance Oracle 12c database on a local filesystem on a stand-alone server to RAC by using ASM.
You installed Grid Infrastructure 12c on a four-node cluster.
Examine this list of possible conversion steps:
1. Create a template and image files from the single-instance database by using DBCA.
2. Perform an RMAN backup of the single-instance database.
3. Validate the cluster using CLUVFY.
4. Copy the template and image files to a cluster node.
5. Restore the RMAN backup to the recovery area disk group on the cluster.
6. Perform an Oracle Database 12c RAC installation.
7. Create a RAC database with DBCA using the RMAN backup.
8. Create a RAC database with DBCA using the template.
Which statement correctly lists the minimum steps required to perform the conversion?

discussion.content:
Correct is E
Convert -dbtype RAC nodo1, add nodo2 y start nodo2

questions.question_text:
Examine this command and output:
//IMG//

Examine this list of commands:
1. srvct1 convert db -db ron -dbtype rac -node o16n1
2. srvct1 convert db -db ron -dbtype raconenode -node 016n1
3. srvct1 add instance -db ron -instance ron_1 -node 016n1
4. srvct1 add instance -db ron -in5tance ron_2 -node 016n2
5. srvct1 start instance -db ron -instance ron_1
6. srvct1 start instance -db ron -instance ron_1
Currently, there is an instance of database ron running on o16n1.
You want to convert ron to a RAC database and make all instances available.
Identify the commands required, in the correct order, to accomplish this.

choices.C: The OCR is backed up by default to a cluster file system location.
choices.A: The OCR can be backed up using ocrconfig.
choices.D: The OLR can be backed up using ocrconfig.
choices.B: The OCR is backed up automatically every four hours.
choices.F: The OLR is backed up by default to a cluster file system location.
choices.E: The OLR is backed up automatically every four hours.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true concerning backups of the OCR and OLR in Oracle Clusterware 12c? (Choose three.)
